articles.title: Recreational marijuana sales begin in Massachusetts
articles.description: Massachusetts became the first state on the East Coast Tuesday to allow recreational marijuana sales, meaning tens of millions of adult consumers, including those in New York City, are now within a three-hour drive from a pot shop. Tony Dokoupil reports.

articles.title: Pressure is on as rain could hamper search for victims in California fires
articles.description: Fire-ravaged communities in Northern California face a new threat, as rain in the forecast could trigger mudslides and flooding. The Camp Fire is now 70 percent contained. Almost 700 people are reported missing, and at least 79 people are dead. Meg Oliver rep…

articles.title: Manhunt for suspect in deadly St. Louis-area Catholic store shooting
articles.description: A manhunt is underway near St. Louis for a suspect in a deadly shooting at a Catholic Supply store. Police say the incident began with at least one sexual assault and ended when a woman was shot and killed. Omar Villafranca reports.

articles.title: Record number of Americans expected to travel for Thanksgiving
articles.description: The Thanksgiving travel rush is underway. AAA predicts more than 54 million Americans will travel at least 50 miles away by Sunday. The holiday weekend is predicted to be the busiest for Thanksgiving travel since 2005. Kris Van Cleave reports.

articles.title: 11/19/18: CBSN Evening News
articles.description: Gunman opens fire at Chicago's Mercy Hospital; San Francisco pizza restaurant hires all-deaf staff.

articles.title: Witnesses describe shooting in downtown Denver
articles.description: One person is dead and four people injured after a shooting in downtown Denver, three blocks from Coors Field. CBS Denver's Jamie Leary reports.

articles.title: Trump pressured to respond to claims that MBS ordered Khashoggi's murder
articles.description: President Trump is facing mounting pressure to respond to claims that Saudi Arabia Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman ordered the murder of Jamal Khashoggi. Associated Press White House reporter Jill Colvin joins CBSN to discuss the latest developments and the …

articles.title: 11/19: CBS Evening News
articles.description: Witnesses describe chaotic aftermath of shooting at Chicago's Mercy Hospital; Deaf staff serves up pizza at top California restaurant Mozzeria

articles.title: 4 dead in chaotic aftermath of Chicago's Mercy Hospital shooting
articles.description: A gunman opened fire at a hospital in Chicago's South Side Monday, prompting doctors and nurses to evacuate. The gunman is dead as well as a Chicago police officer, a doctor and a pharmaceutical assistant. CBS News correspondent Dean Reynolds reports.

articles.title: 4 people dead, including gunman, in hospital shooting in Chicago
articles.description: During a Monday night press conference, police said an officer and three others, including the gunman, are dead after a shooting at Chicago's Mercy Hospital. Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel said a doctor and a pharmaceutical assistant were the other victims.

articles.content: In the not-too-distant future, disasters won't come one at a time. Instead, according to new research, we can expect a cascade of catastrophes, some gradual, others abrupt, all compounding as climate change takes a greater toll. "Facing these climatic changes… [+5671 chars]

articles.title: Thanksgiving weather forecast
articles.description: There could be some pretty rough weather conditions in parts of the country over the Thanksgiving holiday, the busiest travel holiday of the year. David Parkinson, CBS News weather producer, joins CBSN's Paula Reid for a look at the forecast.

articles.title: Group of Democrats to vote against Pelosi's bid as House Speaker
articles.description: A group of 16 Democrats released a letter Monday declaring they would not support Nancy Pelosi's bid for House Speaker. She needs 218 votes, or just over half of the House, to get the position. CBS News political correspondent Ed O'Keefe reports.

articles.title: 4 people found fatally shot in basement of Philly home
articles.description: Philadelphia police say two men and two women were found Monday in the basement of a home with one gunshot wound each to the head. CBS Philadelphia's Joe Holden reports.

articles.title: Nearly 1,000 unaccounted for in California wildfires
articles.description: Dozens were killed by wildfires in California and nearly 1,000 people are still unaccounted for. Crews are searching for victims amid the rubble. CBS News correspondent Meg Oliver joins CBSN with the latest.

articles.title: More than 20 California cities listed as having "unhealthy air"
articles.description: California wildfires created dangerous levels of air pollution across the state. The toxic air could have short-term and long-term health impacts on residents. Ed Avol, a professor of clinical medicine at the University of Southern California, joined CBSN to …

articles.description: The new Fitbit Charge 3 isn't as fancy nor nearly as expensive as the new Apple Watch 4, but it does some of the same things. CBS News Technology Consultant Larry Magid has today's "Eye on Tech."

articles.title: Deaf staff serves up pizza at top California restaurant Mozzeria
articles.description: Mozzeria is one of the top pizza places in San Francisco. It's also one of the first to be entirely owned and operated by people who are deaf. Tracy Smith from "CBS Sunday Morning" reports.

articles.title: Chris Watts sentenced to life for killing wife and daughters
articles.description: A Colorado father was sentenced to life without parole Monday after pleading guilty to murdering his pregnant wife and their two daughters. The judge said it was perhaps the "most inhumane and vicious crime" he's seen. CBS News correspondent Mark Strassmann r…

articles.title: Youth football participation on the decline amid safety concerns
articles.description: This season, at least two players have died of injuries sustained on the football field. Others have broken bones and suffered brain injuries, fueling the debate over the risks of the sport. CBS News national correspondent Jericka Duncan reports.

articles.title: Fight against robocalls intensifies as companies try to stop scammers
articles.description: By early next year, nearly 50 percent of all cellphone calls will be robocalls. Lawmakers proposed legislation to fight scammers, and companies are taking action as well. CBS News correspondent Anna Werner reports.

articles.title: Tracking conditions in California after deadly wildfires
articles.description: After deadly wildfires devastated communities in California, rain is expected to move in. WCBS chief weathercaster Lonnie Quinn has the forecast.

articles.title: Witnesses describe chaotic aftermath of shooting at Chicago's Mercy Hospital
articles.description: A gunman opened fire at a hospital in Chicago's South Side Monday, prompting doctors and nurses to evacuate. The gunman is dead, and one officer is in critical condition. CBS News correspondent Dean Reynolds reports.

articles.title: Search crews rush to find wildfire victims before rain moves in
articles.description: Rain is expected in Northern California Wednesday. It could bring relief after the deadly Camp Fire, but it could also bring the potential for mudslides, complicating the search for victims. CBS News correspondent Meg Oliver reports.
